Data: Stokes to Marsh, no run still two slips, full just outside off stump, pushed to mid-off
Stokes to Marsh, 2 runs full on the stumps, clipped out wide of long leg who runs well to his right to save three
Stokes to Marsh, FOUR runs full on leg stump, clipped down fine and gets four
Stokes to Marsh, no run forward to a length ball just wide of off stump, dabbed into the covers
Stokes to Marsh, no run blocked with bat and pad together coming forward just outside off
Stokes to Marsh, FOUR runs touch wide, touch full and slapped hard past point, well timed
Rankin to Clarke, FOUR runs short and Clarke is waiting for it and pulls hard through square leg, lovely timing
Rankin to Clarke, no run fuller length, blocked on the crease and pushed back up the wicket
Rankin to Clarke, 1 run forward on the stumps and dabbed into midwicket and for the first time in a while, Clarke gets up the other end to Rankin
Rankin to Marsh, no run full length wide enough of off stump to leave alone
Rankin to Marsh, no run full length wide of off stump, left alone
Rankin to Marsh, FOUR runs firm flick square on the leg side, that is delightfully timed and it races away even with the slow outfield
Stokes to Clarke, no run still a couple of slips are in, full on off stump, pushed without timing into the covers
Stokes to Clarke, no run full again, this is a straighter line, pushed to midwicket, again not timed
Stokes to Clarke, no run full delivery just outside off stump, forward and pushed to point
Stokes to Clarke, 1 run length ball just nips back in a touch, Clarke cramped up on the crease but able to work down to long leg

Stokes to Marsh, OUT bouncer, surprise delivery, hooked at and Buttler takes it well above his head, has Marsh gloved this? Yes he has and Stokes makes the breakthrough. Good use of the bumper and it really hurried Marsh who was in no control of the hook which got up on him and brushed the glove, it flew high above Buttler's head but he leaped up with his right hand and made a smart grab
Stokes to Bailey, no run length on off stump, pushed into the covers
Finn to Clarke, FOUR runs full and driven back down the ground, a bit airy and a bit uncontrolled, it was another swing from the crease but got plenty of this and runs away past mid-on
Finn to Clarke, 2 runs pulled this time, not controlled again, this off the splice of the bat and it bloops wide of mid-on for a couple

Finn to Clarke, OUT full, it nips back and strikes Clarke on the pad hanging back on his stumps, given out lbw Clarke has a chat with Bailey and decides to review. Was it going down? Was it too high? Umpire Ravi though it looked good. There's no bat on Hot Spot. Hawk Eye has it clipping the top of leg stump and that is good enough for umpire Ravi and England, Clarke goes, done by a delivery that seamed back in and the ch
Finn to Voges, no run full length delivery outside off, Voges leaves alone, that seamed back a little, not enough for Finn
Finn to Voges, no run pushed at just outside off, this holds it line outside off and beats the outside edge, great line and length
Finn to Voges, no run length on off stump, blocked back in the crease into the covers
Stokes to Bailey, no run full length wide of off stump, left alone
Stokes to Bailey, no run nicely bowled, nibbled away and beat the outside edge with Bailey playing from the crease
Stokes to Bailey, no run similar area, bounces a little on Bailey who keeps it out on the crease into the covers
Stokes to Bailey, no run fuller just outside off, ran to point
Stokes to Bailey, no run full length that slides past the outside edge with Bailey playing forward, well bowled
Stokes to Bailey, no run touch shorter and wide, Bailey leaned back to cut but played and missed
Finn to Voges, no run Finn pitches it up, defended towards mid-on
Finn to Voges, no run short of length ball just outside off, blocked from the crease to the off side
Finn to Voges, no run short of length ball, Voges jumps to get on top of the bounce and defends
Finn to Voges, no run length ball not much width outside off, solidly defended off the front foot
Finn to Voges, no run slanting in towards off stump, length ball from Finn, more defence
Finn to Voges, 2 runs short of length ball on the pads, clipped towards deep square leg for a single
Stokes to Bailey, no run full length, clipped off middle stump straight to Bopara at midwicket, rather missed out there
Stokes to Bailey, no run full length a foot wide of off stump, driven firmly up to mid off
Stokes to Bailey, no run fuller just outside off, dabbed into the covers this time from the crease
Stokes to Bailey, 2 runs back of a length and turned away behind square leg and Bailey gets off the mark
Stokes to Bailey, no run back of a length a foot wide of off stump, knock off the back foot to cover
Stokes to Bailey, no run another back foot push to cover, this was better timed but no better placed
Rankin to Voges, no run good length that shapes away a touch and beats Voges's prod foward
Rankin to Voges, no run full length down the leg side, not by much, Voges went a long way across his stumps and that is a hairs width away from leg stump
Rankin to Voges, 1 leg bye touch straighter, off the thigh pad and behind square for a quick leg bye
Rankin to Bailey, no run full length that again slides past the outside edge outside off stump, batsman feeling for it
Rankin to Bailey, 1 run similarly played and squirted down to third man for just the sixth single of the innings
Rankin to Voges, FOUR runs too straight and clipped fine of long leg for four
Stokes to Bailey, 1 run length ball on the stumps and clipped down to long leg
Stokes to Voges, no run full length wide enogh of off stump to leave alone
Stokes to Voges, no run fuller length but wide enough to ignore again
Stokes to Voges, no run back of a length on off stump, turned into the leg side
Stokes to Voges, no run good length on off stump, blocked back up the wicket
Stokes to Voges, no run length ball wide of off stump, Voges poked at it and played and missed
Rankin to Bailey, no run full length on off stump, played forward and blocked back to the bowler
Rankin to Bailey, no run similar length but a foot wide of off stump and ignored
Rankin to Bailey, no run touch fuller and straighter, pushed up to mid-off
Rankin to Bailey, 3 runs short of a length and Bailey onto it quickly and pulls over midwicket, it plugs in the outfield though, didn't time it perfectly
Rankin to Voges, no run forward and half-plays a ball a foot and a half outside off, it goes through to Buttler
Rankin to Voges, no run good length wide of off stump, left alone comfortably now
Stokes to Bailey, 1 wide leg side, swung at and missed
Stokes to Bailey, no run full and wide of off stump, driven at, gets it off a thick inside edge that runs into midwicket
Stokes to Bailey, no run pulled from a length only just back in length, gets a thick inside edge onto the pad, ball runs to point
Stokes to Bailey, no run full delivery a foot wide of off stump, Bailey pokes at it and misses again, that is just going to happen on a day like today
Stokes to Bailey, 1 run just back in length at the stumps, played with a cross bat and gets it down to long leg
Stokes to Voges, no run just back of a length, dabbed down into the covers
Stokes to Voges, no run just a little short, played off the back foot to cover
Bopara to Bailey, no run full length on off stump, pressed back up towards the bowler
Bopara to Bailey, no run full just outside off, forward and ran into the covers
Bopara to Bailey, no run fuller, wide enough of off stump to allow Bailey to swing the hands at it, times a drive quite well but gets it only as far as mid-off
Bopara to Bailey, 1 run tries to go leg side this time, mid-on is down quickly to save but he can't take it quickly and they take a quick single on the bobble
Bopara to Voges, no run full on the stumps, tucked up towards mid-on
Bopara to Voges, 1 run just back in length, clipped out through midwicket and they get a single to the man in the deep
Tredwell to Voges, no run full length on off stump, played back up the wicket
Tredwell to Voges, no run back and across off stump, clipped to midwicket
Tredwell to Voges, 1 run floated up outside off and ran to point
Tredwell to Bailey, 1 run down the wicket and a flick out to long on
Tredwell to Voges, no run flatter delivery having seen the batsman coming, forces it wide of short third man but the fielder does enough
Tredwell to Voges, 1 run floated up on the stumps, pushed wide of square leg and they get a quick single
Bopara to Voges, 2 runs touch wide and cut wide of third man for a couple
Bopara to Voges, 1 run forward press just outside off, gets it through cover, the deep fielder has to come in a long way but does save the second
Bopara to Bailey, no run full and well wide of off stump, left alone
Bopara to Bailey, no run pleasant drive from another delivery wide of off stump, finds extra-cover
Bopara to Bailey, no run length ball that shapes in, Bailey tries to stay leg side of it and angle down to third man, misses
Bopara to Bailey, 1 run slapped from two feet wide of off stump, mistimed cut out to deep cover
Tredwell to Bailey, 2 runs paddle swept from outside off, gets it fine and there's a chase for deep square leg who saves two
Tredwell to Bailey, SIX runs down the track and a lofted drive sails into the Cathedral stand, good strike and a short boundary is no match for that well timed strike
Tredwell to Bailey, no run flatter and clipped to midwicket
Tredwell to Bailey, no run floated up on off stump, pushed back up the wicket
Tredwell to Bailey, 1 run a skip down, Tredwell fires it in flat, pushed carefully to long on
Tredwell to Voges, 1 run flicked from off stump with the turn through square leg for a single
Bopara to Voges, FOUR runs full and wide and nicked, off the toe of the bat and it squirts wide of Buttler, no one's defending that!
Bopara to Voges, 1 run bit of width again, opens the arms and cracks a cut shot through the off side to the sweeper
Bopara to Bailey, no run down the leg side, Bailey had gone across his stump and misses with a flick
Bopara to Bailey, no run tighter line outside off, hangs back and defends
Bopara to Bailey, 1 run pushed short and in front of square on the off side for one
Bopara to Voges, 1 run angling in, worked off the pads through square leg for another single
Tredwell to Voges, 1 run tossed up on middle stump, Voges goes down on one knee to sweep through backward square
Tredwell to Bailey, 1 run punched back past the bowler for one to long-on
Tredwell to Voges, 2 runs pushed through outside off, drops back and chops past the man on the edge of the circle at backward point, they get back for two

Tredwell to Voges, 1 run nearly a mix-up, as Morgan half-stopped Voges on-drive, it rolled away from the fielder and the batsmen ran, a better throw to the bowler's end would have seen Bailey struggling
Tredwell to Bailey, 1 run flighted, worked with the turn through midwicket
Tredwell to Voges, 1 run drops back outside off and guides one more behind square
Bopara to Voges, no run too wide, Voges hangs back and thrashes a cut shot but it's terrifically stopped on the dive by Ben Stokes at point
Bopara to Voges, no run gets across and defends this time
Bopara to Voges, no run comes forward, pitched up and tailing into the pads, pushed to mid-on
Bopara to Voges, no run good length, in the channel, Voges defends into the off side - another dot
Bopara to Voges, no run goes across his stumps and blocks a length ball into the on side
Bopara to Voges, 1 run stands tall in the crease and prods a length ball down the ground to long-on, preventing a maiden
Tredwell to Voges, 1 run tossed up, played with the spin through square on the leg side
Tredwell to Bailey, 2 runs goes round the wicket, slides the ball on outside off stump, Bailey drops back and times a cut through backward point for a couple more
Tredwell to Bailey, SIX runs floated up in the slot and launched high, high, high into the crowd at long-on, full swing of the bat through the line and it disappears for six
Tredwell to Bailey, no run flatter, straightening on off stump, Bailey gets behind this one in defence
Tredwell to Bailey, 1 run tossed up, nudged in front of square leg for one
Tredwell to Voges, 1 run length ball, Voges plays with the gentle turn for another single through midwicket
Bopara to Voges, 2 runs dug in short and pulled flat, forcefully through midwicket for a couple
Bopara to Voges, no run length ball on middle and off, defended
Bopara to Voges, 1 run pitched up, drifting back in towards off stump, pushed through the covers

Bopara to Bailey, 3 runs drops a little short and neatly paddled through backward square leg by Bailey, there's a good bit of work on the fence from Finn, who goes full length to prevent four but the batsmen take on the arm and get back for a third
Bopara to Voges, no run full and driven fiercely, back down the track and hits Bopara on the boot

Bopara to Voges, OUT bowled him, just tickled a bail and Bopara has struck! He is ecstatic, running off with a huge grin on his face, not quite sure what did for Voges there but he was through the shot early, attempting to pull a ball not quite short enough for the stroke, it passed under the blade and just nudged the woodwork. Maybe just skidded on a touch, rather than bouncing as much as usual, and sold Voges a dummy
Tredwell to Bailey, 1 run tossed up on the stump, tickled back past the bowler for one
Tredwell to Wade, no run round the wicket, full and straightening on middle and off, leans out round the front pad to defend
Tredwell to Wade, no run angled in, little flatter, pushed into the covers coming forwards
Tredwell to Wade, 1 run drops back this time and cuts into the ground, towards cover point and they scamper one
Tredwell to Bailey, no run leans forward and turns the wrists, tapped to leg but the fielder is quickly in
Tredwell to Bailey, 1 run this goes on with the arm across the right-hander, he goes back and forces the ball in front of cover, again a better throw might have made things interesting
Bopara to Bailey, no run length ball in the channel, sits on it and punches into the covers
Bopara to Bailey, 1 run low full toss, driving back past Bopara, who sticks out a boot and misses, stopped at mid-off
Bopara to Wade, no run continues over the wicket, touch short of a length and defended back to the bowler
Bopara to Wade, no run Wade throws the bat at a wide one, again just skips on off the surface and beats the bat
Bopara to Wade, no run fuller, on the front foot, pushed to mid-off
Bopara to Wade, no run back of a length, stays back and punches into the covers, straight to the fielder

Tredwell to Bailey, SIX runs Bailey takes Tredwell to the cleaners again, one step, two step and clouted into the stands at wide long-on again - wasn't to the pitch this time and nearly got under it but still had plenty of gas to clear the rope
Tredwell to Bailey, no run outside leg stump, attempts to sweep but can't get it past the man on the 45
Tredwell to Bailey, FOUR runs tossed up, again wide of leg stump and swept hard, in the air this time through backward square, the dive is in vain and reaches the rope
Tredwell to Bailey, 2 runs nudges a couple through square leg, they come back for two and the throw to Tredwell isn't quite good enough to put pressure on Wade - fifty up for Bailey, well played, sir
Tredwell to Bailey, no run pushed through a little quicker, lets it go outside off
Tredwell to Bailey, 2 runs goes back and nurdles to square leg again, Carberry is quickly on it but another dicky throw means they get two safely
Bopara to Wade, 1 run length ball, outside off, punched through the covers for a single
Bopara to Bailey, 1 run drops back and runs the ball off the face past short third man, who's quickly on to it
Bopara to Wade, 2 runs driven through the off side, the man in the deep has to come in and they get two
Bopara to Wade, 2 runs round the wicket, bit of width and pushed gently towards Root, the cover sweeper, again, they get back for a second as the throw comes in
Bopara to Wade, FOUR runs short and wide and clattered off the back foot through point, room for Wade to throw everything at that and the ball skedaddled to the boundary
Bopara to Wade, 1 run dropped short on the off side, Bailey calls them through for one more
Stokes to Wade, 1 leg bye slightly back of a length, Wade jerks his wrists and manages to punch it into the off side, came off the body
Stokes to Bailey, no run fuller length, outside the line, mistimes a drive towards mid-off
Stokes to Bailey, FOUR runs Stokes drops short and wide and Bailey carts him for four through point, it was in the air but Morgan wasn't getting there
Stokes to Bailey, no run better length, around off stump, tapped defensively into the off side
Stokes to Bailey, no run draws Bailey into pushing at one in the corridor, indeterminate stroke and he's beaten
Stokes to Bailey, 2 runs gets on the front foot again, opens the face and runs the ball to third man, Trott misfields it but manages to rectify the situation before they think about a second run
Finn to Wade, no run pitched up in the channel, punched to mid-off
Finn to Wade, 1 run drops short, at the body, Wade stays back and glances one off his hips
Finn to Bailey, no run more signs of variable bounce, Finn dropping short but the ball grubbing through as Bailey attempted to swivel-pull
Finn to Bailey, 1 run good length in the channel outside off, drops back and guides one down to third man

Finn to Wade, no run short of a length, over the top of the stumps and played with soft hands behind square on the off side, Bailey was sent back by Wade as Morgan seized on the ball but missed with his throw to the non-striker's end as the batsman dived for his ground
Finn to Wade, 2 runs angled across and Wade steers the ball from back in the crease wide of third man for two
Stokes to Bailey, 2 runs length delivery, little bit wide and Bailey chops the ball behind square, third man has to travel to his right and they get two more
Stokes to Bailey, no run angled in towards middle and leg, hits the pad as Bailey flicks and misses, Stokes thinks about an appeal but it was heading past leg stump
Stokes to Bailey, 1 run full and straight again, clipped through backward square for one
Stokes to Wade, no run leg-stump line from over the wicket, slightly back of a length, blocked towards mid-on
Stokes to Wade, no run fuller, in the channel, driven with a high elbow straight to mid-off

Stokes to Wade, 2 runs very agricultural this, about as attractive as a manure heap but Wade gets a couple, tried to brutalise a pull over square, didn't get hold of it but the ball dribbled through midwicket towards the sweeper
Finn to Bailey, 1 run length, seaming in towards middle and leg stump,goes across and glanced through square
Finn to Wade, no run back of a length, outside off, defended square on the off side
Finn to Wade, FOUR runs another rustic heave from Wade, backs away and opens up the off side, slapping a slightly short ball aerially in front of point for four
Finn to Wade, no run that's a jaffa from Finn in response, tight line and defeating an awkward poke from the crease
Finn to Wade, 1 run good line on off stump, defended into the covers and they sneak another single, Wade safe as the throw comes in
Finn to Bailey, 2 runs drops short, not quite there to pull but Bailey manages to scoop it over midwicket, in front of deep square leg for a couple
Stokes to Wade, 1 run Stokes pitches the ball full on leg stump, Wade gets his bat down in time and squeezes the ball between mid-on and midwicket

Stokes to Bailey, FOUR runs drops short, outside the line of off but hoicked over wide mid-on, went quite high without having the distance to get all the way to that corner boundary but it bounces for four
Stokes to Bailey, 2 runs drops back, steers a length ball down to third man
Stokes to Bailey, FOUR runs slower ball from Stokes and thumped on the pull out to deep midwicket, it was in the air a long time but no man out there and it trundles for another four
Stokes to Bailey, no run good length, zipping on outside off and hits the pad, runs to short third man - Stokes appealed but there was an inside edge too
Stokes to Bailey, FOUR runs full and straight, driven on the up, beats the dive of mid-on and that will be another boundary, three for Bailey in the over
Bopara to Wade, no run slightly back of a length, punched off the back foot to point
Bopara to Wade, no run on the legs, nudges the ball behind square but straight to the fielder
Bopara to Wade, 1 run leg-stump line again, manages to work this wide of the man on the edge of the ring
Bopara to Bailey, 1 run gets forward to a full-length ball, dabs one into the covers
Bopara to Wade, 1 run pitched up on the stumps, driven to long-on
Bopara to Bailey, no run good yorker from Bopara, slips the ball under Bailey's bat, outside off and through to the keeper
Root to Wade, 2 runs starts round the wicket to the left-hander, goes down on one knee and paddles a couple fine of long leg
Root to Wade, 2 runs skips down the wicket, looking to menace the ball down the ground, completely miscues and the ball rolls through midwicket for a couple more
Root to Wade, no run slides on with the arm, turned to midwicket
Root to Wade, FOUR runs darts the ball in on off stump, this is a much better shot from Wade, who drills the ball through the covers, in to out and away to the boundary
Root to Wade, no run fired in flat on the stumps, can't get this one away
Root to Wade, 1 run skips forward again and punches past mid-off for one
Bopara to Wade, 1 run slower ball, in the channel and driven, not timed and that's just a single to mid-off
Bopara to Bailey, 1 run little bit short and swatted on the pull, right out of the middle but straight to deep midwicket on the bounce
Bopara to Wade, 1 run digs the ball in short, Wade manages to drag the ball down from almost above his head for a single to square leg
Bopara to Bailey, 1 run uses the feet and drives a half-volley, straight to mid-off, who's set back a bit
Bopara to Wade, 1 run short and outside off, pulled flat and had through midwicket for another single
Bopara to Bailey, no run Bopara goes full and wide, Bailey comes at him and drills the ball like an exocet but picks out mid-off, who takes it cleanly and prevents a run
Tredwell to Wade, no run flat and on the stumps, prodded into the covers

Tredwell to Wade, OUT comes down the pitch, has another flamin' yahoo and gets a thick outside edge, which is plucked from the air at backward point. Wade goes and Carberry is the man with a smart catch! Respite for Tredwell, who continued to give the ball a bit of air, it dipped on Wade and he sliced a drive, looked like it might clear Carberry but he leapt like nimble-footed teenager and took it one-handed
Tredwell to Faulkner, no run over the wicket, flat delivery on off stump, defended
Tredwell to Faulkner, no run pushed through, again not much turn, Faulkner is watchful in defence
Tredwell to Faulkner, 1 run comes forward and turns a run into the leg side

Tredwell to Bailey, OUT Bailey tickles one off his pads, straight to backward square leg and Faulkner is struggling here, Buttler takes Trott's flat throw in front of the stumps and swing his arms back to break the wicket ... It goes up to the third umpire but he is well short and Australia have lost two for one in five balls
Bopara to Bailey, 1 run pitched up on the stumps, clubbed through square leg to the man in the deep
Bopara to Johnson, 1 run slightly back of a length, angled across and Johnson swats at it, gets an inside edge to fine leg
Bopara to Bailey, 1 run good length, the ball shapes back in from wide of the stumps, waits on it and chops one to third man
Bopara to Johnson, 2 runs Johnson lifts his bat up high, waits on a length ball and clips it through midwicket, wide of the sweeper for two
Bopara to Johnson, no run takes the pace off, edged low, bobbling to Buttler's left but he snags it one-handed
Bopara to Johnson, no run full, maybe out the back of the hand and Johnson mistimes a push straight to mid-off
Tredwell to Bailey, no run tossed up, outside off and tapped back towards mid-on
Tredwell to Bailey, no run Tredwell drops this short, hands him the key to the safe, but Bailey thwacks his cut stroke straight at point
Tredwell to Bailey, 1 run flighted, gets forward and pushes one down the ground
Tredwell to Johnson, 1 run round the wicket, tossed up outside off, played with a straight bat down to long-off
Tredwell to Bailey, 1 run spots Bailey on the walk, drags the length down and he can only turn a single through leg

Tredwell to Johnson, OUT skids through the defences, bowled him! Flat delivery from Tredwell, Johnson should have been forward, couldn't get his bat down in time and the ball juddered off stump. Australia have lost three for nine in 17 deliveries
Rankin to Bailey, no run good length, outside off and Bailey prods at it unsuccessfully

Rankin to Bailey, OUT doesn't move the feet again, pushes and nicks off! Another one gone! Just a tickle of a feather of a scrape, Buttler went up immediately and it was just audible on the stump mic, umpire Ravi heard it too and Bailey, the redoubtable George Bailey, falls!
Rankin to McKay, no run and McKay edges his first ball, played it late though and the ball goes to slip on the bounce
Rankin to McKay, no run short and outside off, McKay drops the hands out of the way
Rankin to McKay, 1 run gets in line and drops the ball short on the off side, they trot through for one
Rankin to Coulter-Nile, no run good length, outside the line of off, Coulter-Nile props forward and is beaten
Finn to McKay, 1 run slightly short, goes back and opens the face, runs one to backward point
Finn to Coulter-Nile, FOUR runs nicely timed, gets on the front foot and plants a full-length ball through extra cover for four
Finn to Coulter-Nile, 1 run fast and straight, manages to flick the ball through backward square from in front of the stumps
Finn to McKay, no run coming back in from outside off, stays in the crease and defends
Finn to McKay, no run goes for the bouncer, wide of the stumps and McKay rolls on a pull shot that misses everything
Finn to McKay, no run slightly back of a length, rising steeply as McKay goes for a big ole straight drive, plays about two inches inside the line. Looked good, though
Rankin to Coulter-Nile, no run tight line, slightly short of a length but too close to cut and Coulter-Nile hacks and misses
Rankin to Coulter-Nile, 1 run this kicks like a Red Bull hangover at the batsman, who gets a thick outside edge past slip, the second catcher had been taken out and they get a single to third man
Rankin to McKay, no run shortish, around off stump, defended
Rankin to McKay, no run comes forward and gets bat on this, pushing into the covers
Rankin to McKay, no run beats the outside edge again, this is too good for a No. 11, pitching in the channel and holding its line as McKay pokes forlornly at it
Rankin to McKay, no run sensible leave this time, gets a big stride in and lifts the bat high into the air
Tredwell to Coulter-Nile, 1 run tossed up, chipped into the air towards mid-on but dropping short, they pick up one more

Tredwell to McKay, OUT tries to hit down the ground, grips a little and McKay gets an inside edge on to his pad, then through to disturb the stumps! Australia have been bowled out with 10 deliveries still on the shelf, England taking the last five wickets for 18 runs

1.50pm: It's a good job Australia have George Bailey to provide the meat in their sandwich, else that effort would have been little more than two soggy slices of bread. Between England taking 4 for 57 at the top and 5 for 18 at the bottom, Bailey engineered partnerships of 67 with Adam Voges and 85 with Matthew Wade, meaning they do at least have a heap of beans to defend. Its quite a modest heap, however, and England should be

Welcome back, England need 228 to square the series, Michael Carberry is taking guard and Clint McKay is hoping for the same assistance the England bowlers found. He's on from the Cathedral Road End...
McKay to Carberry, 1 run full length on off stump, Carberry comes forward just outside off and gets a thick edge through square leg, Pietersen calls him through for a quick single
McKay to Pietersen, 1 wide length down the leg side
McKay to Pietersen, FOUR runs full on leg stump and flicked through square leg, poor ball
McKay to Pietersen, no run forward to a length ball just outside off, blocked with an inside edge onto pad that runs towards the slips
McKay to Pietersen, no run full on off stump, a chance to drive, Pietersen doesn't time it and only finds mid-on
McKay to Pietersen, no run good length and it bounces a little on Pietersen as he aims a defensive stroke to the leg side, it beats the bat and strikes him on the hip

McKay to Pietersen, no run good length, comes in a little, Pietersen defends it to the leg side and all's well, except for Carberry who got at least 3/4 of the way down the wicket before realising Pietersen wasn't taking a quick single but managed to run all the way back to make his ground
Johnson to Carberry, no run full on off stump, blocked coming forward, pushing up to mid-on
Johnson to Carberry, no run forward just outside off and pushed to point
Johnson to Carberry, 1 run just back of a length, tried to be paddled around the corner, hurried and gets it high on the bat behind square leg for a single
Johnson to Pietersen, no run full and wide of off stump, shoulders arms
Johnson to Pietersen, 1 run length on off stump, firm push up the wicket and there's a quick single to be had inside mid-off
Johnson to Carberry, no run plays inside a short of a length ball a foot and a half wide of off stump

McKay to Trott, OUT full and wide of off stump, Trott drive first ball and gets a thick outside edge straight to second slip, disastrous shot first ball and Trott's slump continues. That was so wide, only just inside the guidline outside off but for some reason Trott decided to go out to try and drive it. He got a thick edge to shoulder height of Finch who held a solid chance

McKay to Root, OUT full just outside off, Root drive at it and nicks to first slip!! McKay has a hat-trick!! Unbelievable! What a moment for McKay. Dan Christian took a hat-trick in March 2012 and now McKay has repeated the feat. A full ball a couple inches outside off stump, Root, like Trott, aimed a decent-strength drive at it, got a thinner edge but still healthy enough for it to carry through to Watson who held on dow
McKay to Morgan, no run full length just outside off, Morgan comes forward and blocks it up the wicket
McKay to Morgan, no run full and wide and now Morgan is driving and getting a thick inside edge to midwicket
McKay to Morgan, no run full and it swings away and beats Morgan's outside edge
Johnson to Carberry, 1 wide full down leg, Carberry flicks at it and misses
Johnson to Carberry, 1 run full on the stumps, played forward and blocked wide of mid-on and they take a quick single
Johnson to Morgan, no run around the wicket now, bowls a bumper on the stumps, Morgan ducks
Johnson to Morgan, no run another short ball, hurries Morgan who gets hit on the body trying to push into the covers
Johnson to Morgan, 1 run length on off stump, Morgan angles down to third man
Johnson to Carberry, 1 run forward just outside off to dab a length ball into the covers, they take a very well-judged single

Johnson to Morgan, FOUR runs full on off stump and timed nicely through the covers, England need Morgan on top form today and that is a nice start, pleasantly pushed through the off side and now the outfield is drier and that races away
McKay to Carberry, no run good length a foot wide of off stump, Carberry leaves alone
McKay to Carberry, no run full ball a foot wide of off stump that Carberry drives at but this time McKay doesn't find the edge
McKay to Carberry, no run length ball just outside off, Carberry withdraws the bat inside the line, the ball catches the back pad on the way through the keeper, causing a brief appeal
McKay to Carberry, no run forward just outside off, blocked with bat and pad together, was it pad first? Brief cry for lbw, given not out, no review, probably outside the line anyway
McKay to Carberry, no run Carberry takes a step down the wicket but can only push what became a full ball to cover from off stump
McKay to Carberry, no run tries to cut a ball sliding across him but its a little too tight for the stroke and he mistimes it to point
Johnson to Morgan, 1 run length ball a little straight, gets tickled down to long leg
Johnson to Carberry, FOUR runs full on off stump and Carberry times this nicely down the ground, well timed past mid-on
Johnson to Carberry, no run just back in length outside off stump, Carberry shoulders arms
Johnson to Carberry, no run short ball on a good off stump line, Carberry gets under it well
Johnson to Carberry, no run two feet wide of off stump, keeps the bat inside the line

Johnson to Carberry, no run an excellent short ball, fast this it, and well directed, Carberry can't get out of the way and gloves it into his shoulder and then straight up but it comes to ground before the keeper, point or the bowler can get in, lovely delivery
McKay to Morgan, no run full just outside off, driven off the inner half of the bat to mid-on
McKay to Morgan, 2 runs full again outside off, driven off a thick inside edge, not where he was aiming, gets it through midwicket

McKay to Morgan, no run forward to this a long way outside off, there's a huge cry for caught behind, I though Morgan missed it by a mile, there is a noise, not out given but Clarke reviews but the repays show Morgan is a good inch or two away from it, good decision Rob Bailey, easy call really cause Morgan missed it by a mile, well done Matthew Wade - I think not!
McKay to Morgan, 1 wide length down leg, flicked at and missed
McKay to Morgan, no run full and wide, Morgan wants to drive again and plays and misses, closer to the outside edge than the one they reviewed
McKay to Morgan, 1 run forward on middle and off, Morgan blocks out towards point, little seam wobble for McKay
McKay to Carberry, no run just back in length, Carberry covers up around his off stump
Faulkner to Morgan, no run full a foot wide of off stump and pressed into the covers
Faulkner to Morgan, no run full but a good foot or so wide of off stump, Morgan tries to flick it to leg with the angle but it straightens and beats him
Faulkner to Morgan, no run stays in the crease and just blocks this up on the off side
Faulkner to Morgan, no run firm drive to the left of mid-on, Coulter-Nile saves well with a dive, that was nicely timed
Faulkner to Morgan, no run length on the stumps, blocked back to the bowler
Faulkner to Morgan, 1 run length on the stumps, played forward and gets a thick inside edge behind square for a single
McKay to Morgan, no run forward on off stump to block back up the wicket
McKay to Morgan, no run forward to a similar area, another cry for caught behind but this has come back off the seam, beaten the inside edge and taken the top of the pad to the keeper
McKay to Morgan, no run lovely delivery, forward and nipping this away past the outside edge
McKay to Morgan, no run fuller outside off, another nice driven from Morgan doesn't beat the infield, Clarke saving from point
McKay to Morgan, no run forward to a full length ball on middle and off, blocked into the covers
McKay to Morgan, no run forward just outside off and blocked up towards mid-off, another great set from McKay
Faulkner to Carberry, no run full length but too wide to induce a stroke
Faulkner to Carberry, no run shouldered arms again to a ball well wide of off stump
Faulkner to Carberry, no run plays at this though, was a tighter line and it slid past the outside edge, rather hanging the bat outside off
Faulkner to Carberry, no run fuller and wide enough to have Carberry thinking of a dab cut stroke, bit wishy-washy and he plays and misses
Faulkner to Carberry, no run played from the crease around off stump and dabbed into the covers
Faulkner to Carberry, no run forward and dabbing into the covers
McKay to Morgan, no run full and sliding across the off stump, Morgan shoulders arms
McKay to Morgan, no run forward on the stumps and blocked up towards mid-off
McKay to Morgan, FOUR runs full and eased down the ground from off stump, very handsome on-drive
McKay to Morgan, no run McKay adjusts his length and Morgan dabs this to square leg
McKay to Morgan, no run full on off stump, Morgan plays forward and tucks it to midwicket
McKay to Morgan, no run full just outside off stump, punched firmly to mid-off
Faulkner to Carberry, no run forward just outside off to knock into the covers
Faulkner to Carberry, no run forward again to a straighter delivery and tucks this up towards mid-on
Faulkner to Carberry, FOUR runs gorgeous drive, shimmy down the wicket a little to create a fuller length and drove it with expert timing down the ground, his best stroke since his recall
Faulkner to Carberry, no run touch fuller, dug out back to the bowler
Faulkner to Carberry, no run full and aims a flick to the leg side from just outside off, get a thick inside edge onto the pad, good job he got something on that
Faulkner to Carberry, no run forward a good length ball a foot outside off and pushed towards point
Watson to Morgan, no run length ball wide of off stump, left alone
Watson to Morgan, no run shorter and wide enough to try and cuts, gets it off a bottom edge towards backward point
Watson to Morgan, no run wider ball, Morgan chases it with another cut and misses
Watson to Morgan, 1 run tighter line, better length, played at and gets a thick outside edge down to third man
Watson to Carberry, no run full and wide enough of off stump to leave alone
Watson to Carberry, no run similar delivery, left alone again
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, no run length ball wide of off stump, Morgan leaves it alone
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, no run touch fuller and tighter line, Morgan plays from the crease and knocks it out towards point
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, 1 run thick edge playing from the crease again, it flies past slip but third man is exceptionally fine because of these short straight ropes
Coulter-Nile to Carberry, 1 run back of a length on the stumps, tucked through square leg for a single out into the deep
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, no run tight line on a good length, blocked up the wicket
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, no run lets this go past the off stump to Wade
Watson to Carberry, no run full and a foot wide of off stump, left alone
Watson to Carberry, no run length delivery around off stump, played in the crease and knocked out towards point

Watson to Carberry, no run length delivery a foot outside off, Carberry tries to stay leg side of it and cut but it's again too close for the stroke and he can only dab it high on the bat into the covers
Watson to Carberry, 1 run but this ball is there to cut and Carberry angles down to third man for an easy single
Watson to Morgan, no run Morgan advances down the wicket but can only block what became a decent length just outside off, chance of a single into the covers is snuffed out by Clarke in quickly
Watson to Morgan, no run cut and missed outside off stump
Coulter-Nile to Carberry, no run good length wide of off stump, ignored
Coulter-Nile to Carberry, no run tighter line, played forward and pushed up to extra cover
Coulter-Nile to Carberry, no run another ball to cut, nailed it but straight to Clarke at point and unlike Old Trafford this doesn't carry to him
Coulter-Nile to Carberry, no run short ball on the stumps, Carberry gets inside the line
Coulter-Nile to Carberry, 1 run just back of a length on off stump, Carberry dabs it wide of Clarke at point and they take a single
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, 1 run straight line, allows Morgan to hang back and tap to midwicket, they take a quick single
Watson to Morgan, no run full and wide, Morgan goes down on one knee to try and slap it hard square on the off side, misses again though, no joy for Morgan in that area so far
Watson to Morgan, no run similar line, this time Morgan leaves well alone
Watson to Morgan, 1 run another chance for Morgan to free his arms, manages to hit this but only rolls it into the covers, they run hard to try and get a second but the deep cover is in too quickly
Watson to Carberry, no run full on the off stump, played off the inner half of the bat to midwicket
Watson to Carberry, no run Carberry trying to cut again, gets a decent bat on this but not for the first time can only find the fielder

Watson to Carberry, no run short, Carberry stays leg side of it on leg stump and goes to pull but sort of tries to pull out of the stroke, another cry for caught behind from Wade when it's clear this has come off the bicep, another good decision from umpire Bailey
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, no run full on the stumps, blocks up the wicket
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, no run slightly wider and Morgan aims a nudge at this, forcing it to backward point
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, no run step down the wicket, tries to flick this to the leg side, gets an inside edge into pad that almost has Coulter-Nile interested following through
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, 1 run gentle push from a full length to mid-on, they taken on the fielder and get home very comfortably
Coulter-Nile to Carberry, 1 run played up towards mid-on, wide of the fielder so this is an easy single
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, no run back of a length around off stump, dabbed from the crease to point where the fielder is in quickly to save the single
Watson to Carberry, 1 run length delivery in the channel just outside off, Carberry stays leg side of it and dabs down to third man
Watson to Morgan, FOUR runs full length wide of off stump, Morgan swings through the line and lifts it nicely up and over mid-off for a one-bounce four, decent stike
Watson to Morgan, no run tighter line making the drive a little more difficult, can only push this to mid-off
Watson to Morgan, 1 run fourth-stump line on a length, Morgan tucks it behind point and Carberry is quickly through for the single
Watson to Carberry, 1 run good length, driven at a foot outside off, gets a thick inside edge to third man to extremely patiently bring the 50 up
Watson to Morgan, no run no more than a good line and length but Morgan comes out to poke and miss at it outside off
Coulter-Nile to Carberry, 1 run another firm drive outside off from Carberry and another thick edge through to third man
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, no run forward strike and pushed up to mid-off
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, no run dabbed at just outside off, gets a thick inside edge on the bounce not too far from leg stump, Wade is up to save the single
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, no run tucked into the covers from the crease just outside off
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, no run tries to run this down to third man but gets too much bat on it and drops it almost at his feet
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, no run down the track and slapping hard to extra-cover, well struck but too close to the fielder
McKay to Carberry, no run a flicky drive to a full length ball sliding across the off stump, loose and misses
McKay to Carberry, no run steps down the wicket and flashes outside off, misses again, got in a poor position there
McKay to Carberry, no run nibbles one away and beats the bat again, Carberry pressing forward just outside off, McKay back on it straight away
McKay to Carberry, no run tries to guide this down to third man but it was too tight a line and he can only steer off high on the bat to slip
McKay to Carberry, 2 runs you could see this coming really, a big slap from outside off takes a huge outside edge that just evades extra-cover, shot of frustration from Carberry
McKay to Carberry, FOUR runs full wide delivery, slapped hard and this time beats the infield and Carberry finally picks up a boundary, he will be mightily relieved
Johnson to Morgan, no run low full toss and clipped to midwicket
Johnson to Morgan, 1 run dabbed from the crease towards point, they rush through for a single and they fifty partnership comes up, decent rebuilding job from these two, now can they take England on
Johnson to Carberry, 2 runs firm drive past extra-cover, decent timing and gets it wide of deep cover for a couple
Johnson to Carberry, 1 run full on middle and leg, clipped out firmly through square leg to the man in the deep
Johnson to Morgan, no run forward to a length ball on off stump, pushed back to the bowler
Johnson to Morgan, no run off stump line, dabbed from the crease to point
McKay to Carberry, 1 run off stump line, played with the angle wide of slip and they get an easy single
McKay to Morgan, FOUR runs full length, Morgan walks across his stumps and flicks at it, getting enough bat on it to deflect it fine of long leg for four
McKay to Morgan, 2 runs full and wide of off stump, pushed carefully out through the covers and gets it wide of deep cover for a couple
McKay to Morgan, no run full on middle stump, played forward and dabbed to midwicket
McKay to Morgan, FOUR runs another step across the stumps and this time slaps what became a full length ball right over McKay's left shoulder, great timing
McKay to Morgan, FOUR runs and now McKay drags this down and gets pulled hard for four through midwicket, superb timing again
Johnson to Carberry, no run bumper around off stump, Carberry sways inside the line
Johnson to Carberry, 1 run forward just outside off, dabbed into the covers
Johnson to Morgan, no run a foot outside off just back of a length, pushed at firmly and guides it in the range of point who dives to his left and saves well
Johnson to Morgan, no run back in the crease and pushed into the covers

Johnson to Morgan, 2 runs pulled from outside off, not totally in control, there is a man out at deep square but he can't get to his left in time, Marsh fields and then slips over, still saves two though
Johnson to Morgan, no run length delivery wide of off stump, totally ignored
Faulkner to Carberry, 1 run length ball angled in towards off stump, Carberry comes half-forward, opens the face and gets a single down to third man
Faulkner to Morgan, 1 run goes for the paddle sweep with long leg up inside the circle but get an outside edge off his shoulder that almost carries down to third man
Faulkner to Carberry, 1 run full delivery into off stump and again Carberry just dabs it down to third man
Faulkner to Morgan, no run length ball cut at outside off and missed
Faulkner to Morgan, 1 run forward on off stump, little dab into the covers and Carberry is alert for the quick single
Faulkner to Carberry, 1 run back of the hand slower ball on the stumps, Carberry flicks through square leg
Johnson to Carberry, no run back of a length, at the body, tucked to the fielder at square leg
Johnson to Carberry, no run dug in shorter, bouncer outside off stump, left alone

Johnson to Carberry, FOUR runs Johnson goes round the wicket, back of a length and smartly pulled flat through backward square leg, good balance from Carberry, one knee on the air and swivelling through a controlled shot
Johnson to Carberry, no run hits the deck again, back of a length and sears through outside off
Johnson to Carberry, no run back over the wicket, tailing back in towards middle stump, driven on the up to mid-on
Johnson to Carberry, 1 run length ball, shaping back in and nurdled round the corner for a single
Faulkner to Carberry, 1 run slightly full, around off stump and Carberry is on the walk again, clipping one through square
Faulkner to Morgan, 1 run overpitched, Morgan gets forward and clumps it on the full down to long-off
Faulkner to Carberry, 1 run short and swivel-pulled flat through square
Faulkner to Morgan, 1 run waits on a ball in the channel, runs one down to third man
Faulkner to Carberry, no run good length outside off, gets on the front foot, opens the face towards point
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, no run on the stumps, Morgan sits in the crease and blocks back down the track
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, 1 run drops short, at the body, paddled down to fine leg for one
Coulter-Nile to Carberry, no run angled across on a good length, squares up Carberry, who tries to play across the line and is quickly looking over his shoulder as a leading edge rolls to point
Coulter-Nile to Carberry, no run gets across his stumps to defend on off
Coulter-Nile to Carberry, 1 run wee bit short, Carberry lifts the knee and bats a pulled single through square leg
Faulkner to Carberry, 1 run length delivery in the channel, goes back and across and steers one through gully
Faulkner to Morgan, 1 run slower ball, Morgan is advancing and has to readjust, jams the bat down to leg and pushes a single through midwicket
Faulkner to Carberry, no run Carberry walks across and blocks a length ball
Faulkner to Carberry, 1 leg bye again gets across his stumps, tries to flick to leg and it drops just off the cut strip, Faulkner runs across to field but they get one to bring up the England hundred
Faulkner to Morgan, no run opens the face and steers a length ball square on the off side
Faulkner to Morgan, 1 run touch short from Faulkner, stays back and runs a single down to third man this time
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, 1 run angled across from over the wicket, glides another one to that busy third man
Coulter-Nile to Carberry, FOUR runs width and Carberry muscles the ball between deep point and third man, scything mow of the wrists sends the ball to the boundary
Coulter-Nile to Carberry, 1 run oof, gets a little bit of luck, trying to dab the ball to third man but deflecting it past his stumps
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, no run pushes forward and blocks back to the bowler
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, no run good, disciplined stuff from Coulter-Nile, again forcing Morgan to keep a length ball out

Watson to Carberry, 1 run sliding across on a length, stays a bit low and Carberry crouches, guides another single to third man - that's Carberry's fifty, his first for England in any format, coming three years after he made his Test debut and in his fourth ODI innings
Watson to Morgan, no run outside the line of off, pushed towards point
Watson to Morgan, no run Morgan comes out of his crease, attempts to work to leg and the ball pops up into the off side off the thigh pad

Watson to Morgan, FOUR runs gets on the front foot again, lovely timing on the cover drive, just a gentle tap but it's too quick for the sweeper, who can't get round - that's a half-century for Morgan too
Watson to Bopara, no run good length, outside off stump, gets across and defends it watchfully
Coulter-Nile to Carberry, no run pitched up, gets a stride in and plays around the front pad

Coulter-Nile to Carberry, FOUR runs nicely played by Carberry, short and fired across the bows, deliberately uppercut over the fielder in the gully and it bounces away from the chasing third man for four
Coulter-Nile to Carberry, no run lets this one go in the channel
Coulter-Nile to Carberry, 1 run opens the face and runs a length ball to third man
Coulter-Nile to Bopara, no run tight line around off stump, shows it a textbook forward defensive
Coulter-Nile to Bopara, no run gets across and defends, Coulter-Nile continuing to probe in the channel just outside off
Watson to Carberry, 1 run length ball, pitching on leg and hitting the pads, Watson goes up again but umpire Bailey had spotted the inside edge, the ball running behind point
Watson to Bopara, no run dropped short on the off side and Bopara wanted one, he's sent back and only just regains his ground as cover hares in and underarms past the stumps

Watson to Bopara, no run edged and shelled, Wade has dropped a howler! Watson is denied a second wicket, a really good ball bounced and held its line around off as Bopara closed the face, got a thick edge and Wade stuffed it, hit him straight in the stomach, no glove involved
Watson to Bopara, 1 run good length and seaming back as Bopara walks across his stumps, clips one through backward square to get off the mark
Watson to Carberry, 1 run Carberry walks across outside the line and steers one more to third man

Watson to Bopara, no run there's another appeal as Bopara attempts a risky dab into the off side, too close even for a late cut and there's a sound as the ball went through but must have been thigh pad, as the appeal quickly dies in Australian throats
Coulter-Nile to Carberry, no run full toss on leg stump, Carberry fails to cash in, though, tamely clipping the ball to midwicket
Coulter-Nile to Carberry, no run pushed across in the corridor outside off, deflects the ball to backward point

Coulter-Nile to Carberry, 2 runs starts to walk down the track again, pitched up and crunched off the pads, in the air for a bit and spinning, bouncing towards deep square leg, where it's well stopped
Coulter-Nile to Carberry, no run shortish, defended on the back foot

Coulter-Nile to Carberry, FOUR runs drives hard off the back foot, playing away from his body and edged hard and high and past Wade's fingertips - would have been a sensational catch but he couldn't quite get there, instead it's a boundary!
Watson to Bopara, 1 run length ball, around off and punched wide of mid-on for a single
Watson to Buttler, no run in the channel and nipping back, Buttler judges where his off stump is well and lets it go
Watson to Buttler, no run gets a stride in and pushes a fullish ball into the off side

Watson to Buttler, no run full, almost yorker length and Buttler misses trying to clip to leg, hits front then back pad ... but Bailey again shakes his head. Hawk-Eye shows it would have just missed leg stump - another good decision
Watson to Buttler, no run beats the bat, little bit of nibble off a length and Buttler goes fishing
Watson to Buttler, no run comes forward and dabs the ball into the off side, no run - another over tighter than a pair of Kylie's hotpants from Watson
Coulter-Nile to Bopara, no run length ball outside off, comes forward and steers towards point
Coulter-Nile to Bopara, no run hit on the back leg, seaming in off a length but a touch high, above the pads
Coulter-Nile to Bopara, 1 run angling in from outside the line of off again, gets a bit of bat on this and squirts to backward square
Coulter-Nile to Buttler, FOUR runs that's a beautiful stroke from Buttler, minimal stride forward and hitting on the up, laces a cover drive through the infield for four
Coulter-Nile to Buttler, 1 run gets on the front foot and pushes short of mid-off, they're able to scamper one
Coulter-Nile to Bopara, no run gets across to a length ball outside off, dabs towards point - another dot

Watson to Buttler, 3 runs drops short and Buttler paddles a pull shot between mid-on and midwicket, kept it down well but the ball is running into the corner of the ground and won't reach the rope as Faulkner gives chase
Watson to Bopara, 1 run Bopara plays across the line, runs off the leading edge through cover
Watson to Buttler, no run length ball, on off stump, stands tall and closes the face to turn to midwicket, where it's well stopped, Bopara has to get back

Watson to Buttler, no run seaming in and Buttler is hit on the pads again, this time Bailey gives it! After a brief discussion, they ask for the review, there's no doubt on height but Watson was slightly wide on the crease, could be heading down leg ... and that's what Hawk-Eye says, missing leg stump and the decision is overturned. Bailey blots his copybook but the Buttler survives
Watson to Buttler, 1 run length ball, attacking the stumps again, little more leg side and it runs away off the pad towards square
Watson to Bopara, 1 run full length, outside off and driven wristily through the covers to the sweeper
Coulter-Nile to Bopara, no run another edge, another life for Bopara, this time the ball dropping short and bouncing into Wade's gloves! On the plus side for Australia, Wade caught it
Coulter-Nile to Bopara, no run outside off, slightly full and pushed towards mid-off on the front foot
Coulter-Nile to Bopara, 1 run opens himself up and makes room for an almighty smite, gets a thick outside edge and it sails over a vacant third slip to third man on the bounce
Coulter-Nile to Buttler, no run gets on the front foot and drives firmly but straight to mid-off
Coulter-Nile to Buttler, no run good length in the channel, comes forward and taps into the covers
Coulter-Nile to Buttler, 1 run slightly overpitched, on the stumps and on-driven into the ground, back past the bowler and mid-on slithers across to intercept
Faulkner to Buttler, 1 run plays with the bat away from the front pad, inside-edging to backward square leg
Faulkner to Bopara, 1 run turns a length ball off his pads short on the leg side, they think about a second but won't get it as deep square runs in
Faulkner to Buttler, 1 run pushed towards mid-off, tip and run but they're safely home

Faulkner to Stokes, 1 run Faulkner goes over the wicket to the left-hander and there's a shout first ball, as Stokes plays around his pad, Bailey isn't interested this time and it's signalled as a run, the ball rolling into the on side
Faulkner to Buttler, 4 leg byes round the wicket, slightly back of a length and the ball flicks the pad, loops past Wade and will run away for useful byes
Johnson to Stokes, 1 run low full toss veering towards leg stump, just needs a tickle on it for a single to fine leg
Johnson to Buttler, 2 runs slightly overpitched, in the channel outside off, Buttler leans into a well-timed drive through cover, the sweeper has to go to his right and they get two

Johnson to Buttler, 2 runs stays back, opens the face and guides the ball low, off the outside half of the bat past slip, looks like it will beat third man but Faulkner throws himself like a last action hero and claws it back from the rope - sooper work
Johnson to Buttler, 1 run over the wicket, pitched up and clubbed through the covers, on the bounce to Marsh in the deep

Johnson to Stokes, FOUR runs short and wide and slashed hard and high, towards third man, Aaron Finch, who's a little slow in picking it up and then can't quite get there diving forwards, it bounces through him and away for four
Johnson to Stokes, no run full and tailing in, bit of bat involved, I think, before it hits the pad as Johnson appeals
Faulkner to Buttler, 2 runs angled in from round the wicket, works a couple to leg
Faulkner to Buttler, no run length ball kicks up a touch, Buttler drives and comes high off the bat towards cover
Faulkner to Buttler, FOUR runs nicely played and Buttler picks up four, bit of width and he leans into an uppish drive through mid-off, finds the gap and that's another timely boundary
Faulkner to Buttler, no run tighter line and dug out on the full towards point
Faulkner to Buttler, 1 run goes across and turns a single into the leg side
Faulkner to Stokes, 1 run over the wicket, shaping back on and clipped on the half-volley through square leg

Johnson to Stokes, 1 run full length outside off, gets an inside edge driving, the ball rolls in front of square on the leg side and Stokes has to reach for his ground as the throw bullets in after jogging the last few yards
Johnson to Buttler, 1 run waits in the crease and dabs a short ball down into the ground for a cheeky one
Johnson to Stokes, 1 run good, tight line on off stump, Stokes gets forward and turns to leg
Johnson to Buttler, 1 run dug in short, Buttler pulls into the ground and the ball mooches through midwicket for one more

Johnson to Stokes, no run hammered into the deck and Stokes fails to connect on the pull - or does he? Johnson and Wade were convinced, it was a good take from the keeper but umpire Ravi is unmoved. Hot Spot suggesting there might have been a smudge of glove on that
Johnson to Stokes, FOUR runs overpitched and straying down the leg side, Stokes glances it behind square and it bisects the two men in the deep - four!
Watson to Buttler, 2 runs down the leg side, tucked off the pads to fine leg, they get a comfortable two
Watson to Buttler, 2 runs walks across his stumps and clips another length ball through backward square, has to dive to make a second this time
Watson to Buttler, FOUR runs Buttler sits in the crease, opens the face and plays a late dab past the keeper, deliberate shot and it runs for four
Watson to Buttler, FOUR runs he's done it again, another soft-handed glide for four fine of third man! Watson does not look happy but the crowd are bouncing
Watson to Buttler, 1 run pitched up outside off, pushed towards mid-on
Watson to Stokes, 1 run leans out and defends, an inside edge runs into the leg side for another single
Faulkner to Stokes, no run touch full of a length, outside off and driven straight to the man at cover
Faulkner to Stokes, no run shorter, maybe a little pace off it, played off the back foot towards point
Faulkner to Stokes, no run gets on the front foot, can't beat the infield on the off side
Faulkner to Stokes, 2 runs drops short and Stokes pulls meatily in front of square, deep midwicket covers it but they get two
Faulkner to Stokes, no run slightly back of a length, opens the face and steers to point
Faulkner to Stokes, 1 run comes forward, drops the ball short into the off side and they pick up one
Watson to Stokes, no run slightly short, over the top of the stumps and Stokes is tucked up, pulls and misses
Watson to Stokes, 1 run short again, this time Stokes is hit on the body but manages to get off strike
Watson to Buttler, 1 run back of a length, off-stump line, Buttler waits on it and nudges a single through square leg - that's the fifty partnership, and in good time
Watson to Stokes, 1 run bit of width, Stokes plays a back cut and, although he doesn't get it past point, they run one
Watson to Buttler, 1 run in the channel, sits back and opens the face, glides one towards third man, they think about a second but elect against
Watson to Stokes, no run darted across and beats the bat as Stokes pushes at it, Wade again half-appeals
Faulkner to Buttler, no run dabbed short into the covers, Buttler sends Stokes back and he's nowhere near being home but the throw misses
Faulkner to Buttler, no run goes across his stumps and this bounces over the wicket as Buttler attempts to nudge off his hip - Wade holds his head in his hands
Faulkner to Buttler, 1 run tip and run towards mid-off, dives in but safe
Faulkner to Stokes, 1 run goes over the wicket, slightly short and outside the line, Stokes neatly runs it off the face, quite fine but third man keeps them to one

Faulkner to Buttler, SIX runs and there's one of those hefty blows that England needed, Buttler sending the ball back over Faulkner's head, over the rope and all the way into the River Taff! A brutal blow from Buttler, who just stood still and hit through the line, it flew out of the screws, clearing the stand at long-on!
Faulkner to Buttler, 1 run touch short, at the body, tucked into the leg side and Buttler will keep the strike
McKay to Buttler, no run fullish, outside off and worked to midwicket - dot ball

McKay to Buttler, 2 runs length, around off stump, works the ball off the body through square, they'll get back for two and that's a half-century for Buttler, his second of the series - played really well today
McKay to Buttler, 1 run again goes across and tucks a single to leg

McKay to Stokes, 2 leg byes hits Stokes on the front pad and it deflects away through square, McKay is appealing for lbw but it must have pitched outside leg, probably hit outside the line too, they scamper hard and steal a couple more leg byes
McKay to Stokes, no run tight line around middle and leg, plunges forward to defend
McKay to Stokes, no run tries to close the gap and McKay goes short, beats the bat as Stokes swishes and misses
Johnson to Buttler, 1 run slightly back of a length, sprayed across the right-hander, who dabs one through point
Johnson to Stokes, no run short and in the channel, defended down on to the wicket, no run

Johnson to Stokes, FOUR runs another bumper, or more like half-tracker and Stokes treats this like a Sunday afternoon pie, swatting a muscular pull over mid-on and away to the boundary, easing the pressure further
Johnson to Stokes, no run takes the pace off, gets across to defend

Johnson to Stokes, 1 run full, tailing in and dug out to mid-on, sends Buttler back and a good job, as there's a direct hit, which they then decide to run on, Stokes scrambling to the danger end but it's Buttler who's in trouble, no one up to the stumps though and he gets in, the throw wayward. Drama!
Johnson to Buttler, 1 wide slung down the leg side, short and wide - huge cheers from the crowd
Johnson to Buttler, 2 runs drops short again, Buttler pulls flat through square and they pick up another couple
McKay to Tredwell, no run slightly full, on the stumps and punched towards mid-on, they decide not to chance it
McKay to Tredwell, no run dances down the track, swings his bat in the wind and misses a short ball outside off, sails through to Wade
McKay to Tredwell, no run back of a length, stays in the crease and defends
McKay to Tredwell, 1 run short and wide and pushed across, Tredwell throws the bat and bottom edges towards cover, they trot one

McKay to Buttler, 1 leg bye drops short, Buttler plays across the line and misses, hits him in the midriff and rolls into the off side, they have to run and do, no direct hit and Buttler keeps the strike

Johnson to Buttler, SIX runs smashed it, absolutely SMASHED!! This is an awesome strike of the ball, Johnson went slightly full on middle and leg, Buttler wasn't to the pitch but managed to cart it absolutely miles, over deep midwicket, nearly into orbit above Cardiff and it drops into the crowd, swallowed up by the shadows lengthening over the stand
Johnson to Buttler, no run frees the arms again but can only dig this out to short midwicket

Johnson to Buttler, FOUR runs fullish, on the stumps and bunted straight back down the ground - that's four and Buttler has won it, a tense, sweaty three-wicket victory for England, which levels the series at 1-1 with one to play
England won by 3 wickets (with 3 balls remaining)
Player of the match is Jos Buttler, ENG
